 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׂנִיר‎</span> **proper name, of a mountain** <span class="bdbLangGreek">Σανειρ</span>: Amorite name of Hermon [[Deut.3.9|Deut 3:9]], whence came cypress-trees [[Ezek.27.5|Ezek 27:5]], probably northern peak(s) of Hermon [[1Chr.5.23|1Chr 5:23]]; [[Song.4.8|Song 4:8]] (where + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֶרְמוֺן‎</span>); so Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Abulf|Abulf]]<sup>ed. Par. 68</sup>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, [[Eccl.24.13|Eccl 24:13]] ***al.***, Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***Saniru***</u></abbr> [[BDB#COT|COT]]<sup>[[Deut.3.9|Deut 3:9]]</sup> [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>Pa 104</sup>. See also [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>[[Deut.3.9|Deut 3:9]]</sup> [[BDB#Buhl|Buhl]]<sup>Geogr. 110 f.</sup> and references [[[BDB#van d.H.|van d. H.]] erroneous <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁ‎</span> Deuteronomy Cant].
